summary.narrativeincludeclinical:
Initial report received on 14 Jul 2009 in the form of a civil complaint (docket #09 CV 6213) received via an attorney. The attorney alleged that this consumer (plaintiff) received Zometa (zoledronic acid) injections and subsequently developed osteonecrosis of the jaw that caused severe and permanent physical and medical injuries and associated disabilities, pain and suffering and mental anguish including a loss of enjoyment of life. At the time of this report the consumer's condition was unknown. No further medical information was provided.
Follow up received from the consumer's attorney inclusive of dental records on 16 Sep 2010: Dental records dated 14 Aug 2001 to 18 Feb 2008 indicated the patient had osteoarthritis, generalized early periodontitis, acid reflux, radiation cough, heart valve and low thyroid. The consumer's medical records also inclusive of updates of medical records and concomitant medications.
Follow up received 12 Oct 2010 via the consumer's attorney inclusive of prescription record: The patient was treated with amoxicillin for osteonecrosis of the jaw. No other details were provided
Follow-up received on 28 Oct 2010 and 03 Nov 2010 from the consumer's attorney has been combined. The patient's medical history and start and stop dates of Zometa were updated. Follow-up received 03 Nov 2010 from the consumer's attorney contained medical records. Small left pleural effusion vs pleural thickening was found on x-ray 14 Mar 2005 after the patient complained of weakness and arm pain. Metastatic lesions to the bony pelvis, right sacrum, intertrochanteric portion of the right hip, left iliac bone, left inferior pubic ramus/ischium and L5 were found by MRI of the pelvis on 12 Jul 2005. CT scan of the abdomen 03 Nov 2005 found diverticulosis. On 22 Dec 2005 the patient was hospitalized with an abdominal mass and bilateral adnexal cysts which were benign, but the patient "wanted everything removed" and underwent laparoscopic bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy. She also had a tumor on the adrenal gland.Dental records dated 18 May 2006 noted percussion sensitivity of teeth numbers 19 and 20 and exostosis of the lower right. Also noted was decay of the left lower molar crowns. Dental records dated 23 May 2006 noted discomfort of the left lower quadrant, gum pain and root canal of tooth # 18. Medical records dated 28 Jul 2006 noted removal of left lower molar and diagnosis of osteonecrosis of the jaw.
Follow up received on 11 Nov 2010 via the consumer's attorney: The patient's medical history was updated to include radiation induced pneumonitis with some pulmonic scarring, thoracotomy, and hyperlipidemia.
Follow-up received on 24 Nov 2010 via consumer's attorney inclusive of medical records. Records dated 31 Mar 2008 stated that the patient had fibroma with superficial keratosis of left buccal mucosa.
Follow-up received on 02 Dec 2010 via consumer's attorney inclusive of medical records. Records dated 19 Apr 2007 sated that the patient had hiatal hernia. Records dated 26 Mar 2010 stated that the patient had small hypoechoic lesion in the left lobe of liver, gallbladder wall thickening. Records dated 23 Mar 2009 stated that the patient had multiple vertebral lesions in T8, L2. Records dated 12 Apr 2008 stated that the patient had S1 vertebral body fracture. Records dated 08 Mar 2007 stated that the patient had bulky right paraspinal soft tissue mass at T8-T9, spinal stenosis at L3-L4, facet arthropathy, disc bulges. Records dated 03 Nov 2005 stated that the patient had chronic atelectasis.
Follow-up received on 10 Dec 2010 and 14 Dec 2010 from the consumer's attorney: The patient's medication regimen was updated. Medical records dated 13 Oct 2008 indicated the patient had carcinoid tumor and stable asthma. On 03 Apr 2009, patient had URI (upper respiratory infection) with postnasal discharge. Medical records reported the patient also had severe gas, cramping in feet and legs and mild aortic regurgitation. The outcome of events was not reported.
Follow-up received on 17 Jan 2011 via consumer's attorney inclusive of medical records. Records dated 26 Mar 2010 stated that the patient had gallstone. Records dated 16 Apr 2010 stated that the patient had solid mass in the lower pole of the right kidney, sigmoid colon polyp. Records dated 08 Sep 2010 stated that the patient had multiple polyps in the stomach, dysphagia. History of schatzki's ring was updated.
Combined follow-up reports received on 23 Mar 2011, 28 Mar 2011 and 31 Mar 2011 via consumer's attorney inclusive of medical records. As reported in Dec 2005, the patient's ovaries were removed and they were found negative for cancer. In Jul 2005, she had surgery to remove excess bone on joint of left big toe. Patient's history was updated to include probable lipoma, anal papilla, moderate non-bleeding internal and external hemorrhoids, stricture/stenosis of esophagus, duodenitis, gastritis and diaphragmatic hernia. The lab test reports dated 12 Feb 2007 and 12 Aug 2009, indicated the significant increase in pancreastatin level. The lab test reports dated 28 Nov 2007 and 10 Dec 2007, indicated the "significant increase in neurokinin A level". Records dated 27 Jan 2009, stated that the patient had a wound in the left lateral inferior gum with exposed bone. Records dated 27 Aug 2010, stated that the patient had hip replacement. The outcome of events was not reported.
Follow-up received on 06 Apr 2011 and 7 Apr 2011 via consumer's attorney inclusive of medical records. The patient's demography updated for birthday. Record dated 23 May 2006 noted for vertical tooth fracture of tooth #18. On 27 Jul 2006 visit, the patient was complaining about left jaw pain and left jaw swelling and she was on Cipro and Metronidazole. On 28 Jul 2006, the dentist performed extraction of tooth#18, debridement of wound and harvesting of bone for biopsy and for culture. He administered 1 mg topical minocycline in bioresorbable polymer into the #18 wound and prescribed Chlorhexidine oral rinse and Percocet. On 03 Aug 2006, biopsy result noted for acute and chronic periodontis with viable mature bone fragments in left mandible and left mandible bone reported non-vital bone sequestrum. On 07 Aug 2006 postoperative visit, the patient was complaining about she was "constipated and now have soft stools" but her jaw felt much better. The dentist advised her to continue with Chlorhexidine oral rinse. On 14 Aug 2006, the patient called her dentist and reported Peridex was causing sore throat and slight tongue swelling. On 04 Jan 2007, the patient called and reported stomach upset due to antibiotics and her doctor prescribed Nexium. On 08 May 2007 visit, she reported some gastritis on endoscopy and the dentist noted lingual bone exposed at tooth# 19 and recommended to continue with Peridex rinse and on 02 Oct 2007, the dentist assessed continued "BRONJ" without advancement of disease. On 15 Jan 2009 visit, the patient reported her gums were inflamed and irritated on the lower left. On 23 Jul 2010, the patient admitted into the hospital due to degenerative arthritis in the left hip and she underwent operation for it and discharged on 27 Jul 2010 and from 31 Jul 2010 she was undergone physical therapy at skilled nursing home. Additional medical records received indicated that on the 22 Jul 2008, patient had an incomplete tear of the left ear lobe. On Sep 2008, patient had ear piercing. On 08 Dec 2008, the incomplete tear of the left ear lobe was repaired.
Follow-up received on 21 Apr 2011 via consumer's attorney inclusive of medical records. Medical history and concomitant medications updated. Record dated 23 Jul 2007 noted for CT scan of Lumbar/thoracic which reported grade 1/2 spondylolisthesis with bilateral spondylolysis at the L5-S1 level. On 19 Nov 2007, the patient had nuclear medicine bone scan, whole body reported focal radiotracer uptake involving the left mandible was comaptible with known history of osteonecrosis. On 01 Apr 2008, left humerus, internal and external rotation views reported mild to moderate DJD at AC joints. On 12 Apr 2008, MRI of thoracic and lumbar spine reported grade 2 anterolisthesis at the L5-S1 level with associated spondylolysis which associated with marked bilateral neural foraminal narrowing. On 23 Mar 2009, MRI of thoracic/lumbar reported degenerative disc disease also noted at L2-L3, L3-L4 and L4-L5. Record dated 05 Aug 2009 reported that the patient underwent nuclear medicine examination procedure due to bone pain at left arm, left pelvis and right leg and, subcutaneous tumor at right back.
Combined follow-up received on 06 May 2011 and 18 May 2011 via consumer's attorney inclusive of medical records. Patient's weight and height was added. Medical history, concomitant and treatment medications updated. Records dated 19 Sep 2004 noted that the patient had history of retrolisthesis at L4-5, left great toe pain, left hallux rigidus, osteophyte, knee pain and left first metatarsal cheilectomy was performed. On 11 Jul 2006, she had biopsy of soft tissue of back or flank and results reported on 06 Sep 2006 metastatic neuroendocrine neoplasm consistent with previous material On 19 Apr 2007, she had EGD with biopsy reported post radiation change in the esophagus; irregular SC junction, hiatal hernia and erosions, multiple in the antrum and biopsy reported reactive gastropathy of common pattern. Record dated 04 Dec 2009 from hospital noted for Zometa caused osteonecrosis of jaw which resolved in May 2009 after removing left molar. On 16 Apr 2010, she had colonoscopy with polypectomy which reported diverticulosis in the descending and sigmoid colon; diminutive polyp in the sigmoid colon. Also, she had CT scan of abdomen/pelvis reported development of a solid mass involving the lower pole of the right kidney and this was very suspicious for a hypernephroma; no evidence of metastatic carcinoid tumor;small left pleural effusion of uncertain etiology and probable right adrenal adenoma. On 07 May 2010, the patient admitted in to the hospital due to renal mass and right flank pain for 4 months, episodic in nature.She did have a CAT scan which showed a small tumor in the lower portion of kidney and she was undergoing a right hand assisted laparoscopic nephrectomy She was discharged on 09 May 2010 with the prescriptions for Percocet and Colace. The biopsy of right kidney mass 0n 10 May 2010 reported metastatic atypical carcinoid involving kidney and perinephric fat, lymphatic channel invasion identified and ureteral margin negative for neoplasia. The patient admitted in to the hospital on 23 Jul 2010 due to degenerative joint disease and osteoarthritis of left hip and left hip pain and she underwent total hip replacement. She was discharged on 27 Jul 2010 with discharge medication Percocet plus preadmission medications. The biopsy of left hip and total joint replacement reported degenerative joint disease.
Follow-up received on 18 May 2011 via consumer's attorney inclusive of medical records. Record dated Jun 2009 noted for exposed bone in left jaw fell out leaving no other exposed bone. Record dated 25 Aug 2009 noted for tumor between 11th and 12th ribs and recommended chemotherapy with cisplatin and etoposide. On 26 Aug 2009, Whole body plannar bone scan reported abnormal study suggesting areas of uptake consistent with metastatic bone disease. Record dated 25 Jun 2010 noted for pain in left pelvis. Record dated 31 Jul 2010 noted for dyspnoea with moderate exertion, impaired gait, decreased activity tolerance, decreased left lower extremity range of motion, and decreased weight bearing on left lower extremity and the patient was under physical therapy rehabilitation treatment. Record dated 16 Sep 2010 noted for she was having tinglings in her legs consistent with the carcinoid she had removed from her spine decade ago. On 21 Sep 2010, the patient had MRI scan of lumbar spine reported osseous metastatic disease involving the lumbar spine and sacral spine; L5-S1 spondylosis and grade 2 anterolisthesis and moderate multilevel spondylotic changes.
Follow-up received on 20 Jun 2011 via consumer's attorney inclusive of medical records: The patient had relevant medical history of shortness of breath. The record dated 14 Nov 2006, stated that ECG revealed inferior myocardial infarction. On 14 Jul 2007, CT scan of the thorax was performed and it revealed lymphadenopathy. The final outcome of the events was not reported.
Follow up received on 05 Jun 2012 via a consumer's attorney inclusive of medical records: Record dated 22 Dec 2005 noted that patient has received Zometa for the treatment of bone cancer at an unspecified dose. No other information was provided.
Follow up received on 24 Jul 2012 via a consumer's attorney inclusive of medical records: Patient history included painful feet was updated. Patient's family history includes mother breast cancer, uterine carcinoma and father stomach problem was updated. Record dated 31 May 2005 noted central necrosis, weakness in left arm, pain in the sacrum, metastases present in the L2, L5 vertebral bodies and sacrum. Record dated 11 Oct 2005 noted diffused erythema. Record dated 08 Mar 2007 noted mild thoracic spondylosis. The outcome of the event bone pain was stated as improving while outcome for other events was not reported.
Follow-up received on 10 Aug 2012 via consumer's attorney inclusive of medical records. Patient's family history included diabetes mellitus and hypertension. Patient's medical history included resection of a neuroendocrine tumor from lung (1992). Record dated 20 Oct 2004 stated that the patient had thyroid disease. Record dated 22 Dec 2005 stated that the patient had ovarian serous cystadenoma. The outcome of the events was not reported.
Follow-up report received from the consumer's attorney on 31 Aug 2012 inclusive of medical records: Record dated 15 Feb 2006, noted that the patient had breast calcifications. Record dated 21 Jun 2010, stated that the patient suffered from metastases to pelvis. The outcome of the events was not reported.
Follow up received on 19 Oct 2012 from physician via consumer's attorney inclusive of medical records. Record dated 24 May 2005 noted malignant neoplasm of trachea, bronchus and lung. In Jul 2006, the patient underwent oral surgery for osteonecrosis of the jaw. Record dated 25 Jul 2006 noted mandibular pain. Record date 27 May 2009 noted malignant neoplasm of articular cartilage. Record dated 05 Sep 2011 noted metastases to heart and mediastinum. Record dated 25 Jan 2012 noted liver metastases involving all lobes. Record dated 03 July 2012 noted secondary neuroendocrine tumor of liver. The outcome of the events was not reported.
Follow up received on 07 Dec 2012 via a consumer's attorney inclusive of medical records. Record dated 13 Jul 2011 noted that patient was suffering from small cyst in kidney. Record dated 31 Aug 2011 noted that patient suffered from left rib fracture. Record dated 18 Jan 2012 noted that patient underwent surgery of jaw for Zometa induced osteonecrosis of jaw. Same records mentioned that patient had developed osteoporosis secondary to Zometa use and suffered from metastases to retroperitoneal. Record dated 25 Apr 2012 noted that patient was suffering from cardiac murmur. The outcome of the events was not reported.
summary.sendercomment: MAC: Review of available data reported in this legal case does not allow for proper causality assessments. Treatment dates with Zometa are not reported. Some conditions found in the report may not have developed under treatment with the product. The patient's events may be attributable to the underlying malignancy.
